solution.text:
No. of cards in a deck of playing cards \(=52\)
No. of jacks in a deck of playing cards \(=4\rightarrow\) One for each suit
No. of queens in a deck of playing cards \(=4\rightarrow\) One for each suit
Probability of getting \(10\) points=\(\frac{4+4}{52}\)
\(=\frac{8}{52}\)
\(=\frac{2}{13}\)

content.text:
You are playing a card game where you need to pick one random card from the deck of \(52\) cards.
You get \(10\) points if you pick a Queen or Jack and \(20\) points if you pick a King.
What is the probability of getting 10 points?
